tool.name: GATK4 AUTO CollectReadCounts
tool.description: - Collects read counts at specified intervals
tool.command:
#include source=$set_sections# #include source=$pre_gatk_excl_ints_chth# #include source=$bam_index_pre_chth# #include source=$pre_gatk_ints_chth# @CMD_BEGIN@ CollectReadCounts #if $common.add_output_sam_program_record $common.add_output_sam_program_record #end if
#if $common.add_output_vcf_command_line $common.add_output_vcf_command_line #end if
#if $optional.arguments_file --arguments_file $optional.arguments_file #end if
#if $optional.cloud_index_prefetch_buffer --cloud-index-prefetch-buffer $optional.cloud_index_prefetch_buffer #end if
#if $optional.cloud_prefetch_buffer --cloud-prefetch-buffer $optional.cloud_prefetch_buffer #end if
#if $optional.disable_bam_index_caching $optional.disable_bam_index_caching #end if
#if $common.disable_read_filter --disable-read-filter $common.disable_read_filter #end if
#if $optional.disable_sequence_dictionary_validation $optional.disable_sequence_dictionary_validation #end if
#if $common.disable_tool_default_read_filters $common.disable_tool_default_read_filters #end if
#include source=$gatk_excl_ints_chth# #if $optional.format --format $optional.format #end if
#if $common.gatk_config_file --gatk-config-file $common.gatk_config_file #end if
#if $optional.gcs_max_retries --gcs-max-retries $optional.gcs_max_retries #end if
#include source=$gatk_bam_input# #if $optional.interval_merging_rule --interval-merging-rule $optional.interval_merging_rule #end if
#if $common.interval_set_rule --interval-set-rule $common.interval_set_rule #end if
#include source=$gatk_ints_chth# #if $common.lenient $common.lenient #end if
--output $output #if $common.QUIET $common.QUIET #end if
#if $common.read_filter --read-filter $common.read_filter #end if
#if $common.read_validation_stringency --read-validation-stringency $common.read_validation_stringency #end if
#include source=$ref_opts# #if $common.seconds_between_progress_updates --seconds-between-progress-updates $common.seconds_between_progress_updates #end if
#include source=$gatk_seqdict# #if $optional.sites_only_vcf_output $optional.sites_only_vcf_output #end if
#if $common.use_jdk_deflater $common.use_jdk_deflater #end if
#if $common.use_jdk_inflater $common.use_jdk_inflater #end if
#if $common.verbosity --verbosity $common.verbosity #end if

param.name: arguments_file
param.label: Arguments_File
param.help: read one or more arguments files and add them to the command line

param.name: cloud_index_prefetch_buffer
param.label: Cloud Index Prefetch Buffer
param.help: Size of the cloud-only prefetch buffer (in MB; 0 to disable). Defaults to cloudPrefetchBuffer if unset.

param.name: cloud_prefetch_buffer
param.label: Cloud Prefetch Buffer
param.help: Size of the cloud-only prefetch buffer (in MB; 0 to disable).

param.name: disable_bam_index_caching
param.label: Disable Bam Index Caching
param.help: If true, don't cache bam indexes, this will reduce memory requirements but may harm performance if many intervals are specified. Caching is automatically disabled if there are no intervals specified.

param.name: disable_sequence_dictionary_validation
param.label: Disable Sequence Dictionary Validation
param.help: If specified, do not check the sequence dictionaries from our inputs for compatibility. Use at your own risk!

param.name: format
param.label: Format
param.help: Output file format.

param.name: gcs_max_retries
param.label: Gcs Max Retries
param.help: If the GCS bucket channel errors out, how many times it will attempt to re-initiate the connection

param.name: interval_merging_rule
param.label: Interval Merging Rule
param.help: Interval merging rule for abutting intervals

param.name: sites_only_vcf_output
param.label: Sites Only Vcf Output
param.help: If true, don't emit genotype fields when writing vcf file output.

param.name: add_output_sam_program_record
param.label: Add Output Sam Program Record
param.help: If true, adds a PG tag to created SAM/BAM/CRAM files.

param.name: add_output_vcf_command_line
param.label: Add Output Vcf Command Line
param.help: If true, adds a command line header line to created VCF files.

param.name: disable_read_filter
param.label: Disable Read Filter
param.help: Read filters to be disabled before analysis

param.name: disable_tool_default_read_filters
param.label: Disable Tool Default Read Filters
param.help: Disable all tool default read filters (WARNING: many tools will not function correctly without their default read filters on)

param.name: gatk_config_file
param.label: Gatk Config File
param.help: A configuration file to use with the GATK.

param.name: interval_set_rule
param.label: Interval Set Rule
param.help: Set merging approach to use for combining interval inputs

param.name: lenient
param.label: Lenient
param.help: Lenient processing of VCF files

param.name: QUIET
param.label: Quiet
param.help: Whether to suppress job-summary info on System.err.

param.name: read_filter
param.label: Read Filter
param.help: Read filters to be applied before analysis

param.name: read_validation_stringency
param.label: Read Validation Stringency
param.help: Validation stringency for all SAM/BAM/CRAM/SRA files read by this program. The default stringency value SILENT can improve performance when processing a BAM file in which variable-length data (read, qualities, tags) do not otherwise need to be decoded.

param.name: seconds_between_progress_updates
param.label: Seconds Between Progress Updates
param.help: Output traversal statistics every time this many seconds elapse

param.name: use_jdk_deflater
param.label: Use Jdk Deflater
param.help: Whether to use the JdkDeflater (as opposed to IntelDeflater)

param.name: use_jdk_inflater
param.label: Use Jdk Inflater
param.help: Whether to use the JdkInflater (as opposed to IntelInflater)

param.name: verbosity
param.label: Verbosity
param.help: Control verbosity of logging.

tool.help:
Collects read counts at specified intervals. The count for each interval is calculated by counting the number of read starts that lie in the interval.
Inputs ~~~~~~
- SAM format read data - Intervals at which counts will be collected. The argument interval-merging-rule must be set to IntervalMergingRule#OVERLAPPING_ONLY and all other common arguments for interval padding or merging must be set to their defaults. - Output file format. This can be used to select TSV or HDF5 output.
Output ~~~~~~
- Counts file. By default, the tool produces HDF5 format results. This can be changed with the format option to TSV format. Using HDF5 files with CreateReadCountPanelOfNormals can decrease runtime, by reducing time spent on IO, so this is the default output format. The HDF5 format contains information in the paths defined in HDF5SimpleCountCollection. HDF5 files may be viewed using `hdfview <https://support.hdfgroup.org/products/java/hdfview/>`__ or loaded in python using `PyTables <http://www.pytables.org/>`__ or `h5py <http://www.h5py.org/>`__. The TSV format has a SAM-style header containing a read group sample name, a sequence dictionary, a row specifying the column headers contained in SimpleCountCollection.SimpleCountTableColumn, and the corresponding entry rows.
Usage example ~~~~~~~~~~~~~
::
gatk CollectReadCounts \ -I sample.bam \ -L intervals.interval_list \ --interval-merging-rule OVERLAPPING_ONLY \ -O sample.counts.hdf5
